fields_of_interest: Trade, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, External Relations
eu_initiatives: TTIP, EU-Singapore FTA, CETA, other trade negotiations, ISDS, ICS, extra-EU BITs and intra-EU BITs, arbitration, dispute resolution, FDI screening
organisation_name: European Federation for Investment Law and Arbitration (EFILA)
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
goals__remit:
The European Federation for Investment Law and Arbitration (EFILA) has been established in Brussels to promote the knowledge of all aspects of EU and international investment law, including arbitration, at the European level. EFILA endeavours to facilitate a meaningful exchange of views on relevant and timely issues vital to the development of the European internal market, in order to contribute to a more favourable investment climate in Europe and beyond.  
 
EFILA will serve as a platform for a merit-based discussion on European and international investment law. In particular, it will foster an objective debate about the current system of investment arbitration. As a think tank EFILA will analyse the scope and use of investment arbitration, especially from a European perspective.
relevant_communication:
EFILA has organized several conferences and lectures on the EU's investment policy. 
It has also published several analytical papers and participated in the TTIP consultation and will also participate in the consultation for a multilateral investment court.  
All publications and activities are published on our website. 
EFILA has also been answering questions from media, EP, national parliaments.
legal_status: international non-profit association under Blegian law: AISBL
